c:complexType.name: BulletChart
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The options documentation class of the Bullet chart.
This chart type was only partially updated, to support some of the new CCC v.2 features.
The bullet chart's data translator accepts data of the following form without requiring any further configuration:
Number of columns
Structure
1Value
2Title | Value
3Title | Value | Marker
>= 4 Title | Subtitle | Value | Marker | Ranges
To use the bullet chart's visual roles in its most general form, it is required to manually configure the data translator, by using .

c:property.name: clickAction
c:property.c:documentation: A callback function that is called when the user clicks on a visual element.

c:property.name: axisDoubleClickAction
c:property.c:documentation: A callback function that is called when the user double-clicks on a bullet's title or sub-title.

c:property.name: titleRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The title visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents the title of each bullet.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: subTitleRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The subTitle visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents the sub-title of each bullet.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: valueRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The value visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents the main measure under analysis, for a given title and sub-title categories, and is visually encoded by the length of a bar visual element.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: markerRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The marker visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents a set of reference or target values for a given title and sub-title categories, and is visually encoded by the positions of markers/dots along the bullet's axis.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: rangeRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The range visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents classification threshold values of the value visual role.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: bullet
c:property.c:documentation: The bullet plot.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the chart.

c:complexType.name: BulletChartExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the bullet chart types.
This bullet chart type was only partially updated, to support some of the new CCC v.2 features.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
extension property (ex: base)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: base_strokeStyle (see ).

c:argument.name: datum
c:argument.c:documentation:
An object describing the data of the double-clicked bullet. The object has the following properties:
title
formattedTitle
subtitle
formattedSubtitle
ranges
formattedRanges
measures
formattedMeasures
markers
formattedMarkers

c:complexType.name: BulletPlot
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The options documentation class of the Bullet plot.
This bullet chart type was only partially updated, to support some of the new CCC v.2 features.

c:property.name: visualRoles
c:property.c:documentation:
The plot's visual roles map.
See for more information.

c:property.name: margin
c:property.c:documentation: The top margin, for vertical orientation, or left margin, for horizontal orientation, in pixel units.

c:property.name: spacing
c:property.c:documentation: The space between bullets, in pixel units.

c:property.name: size
c:property.c:documentation: The orthogonal size of each bullet, in pixel units.

c:property.name: title
c:property.c:documentation:
The default bullet title.
Used when no data is supplied or when the title role is unbound.

c:property.name: subtitle
c:property.c:documentation:
The default bullet sub-title.
Used when no data is supplied or when the subTitle role is unbound.

c:property.name: markers
c:property.c:documentation:
The default bullet markers.
Used when no data is supplied or when the marker role is unbound.

c:property.name: measures
c:property.c:documentation:
The default bullet measures.
Used when no data is supplied or when the value role is unbound.

c:property.name: ranges
c:property.c:documentation:
The default bullet ranges.
Used when no data is supplied or when the range role is unbound.

c:property.name: titlePosition
c:property.c:documentation: The side of the bullet where the title and sub-title are placed.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.

c:complexType.name: BulletPlotExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the bullet plot type.
Plot extension points can be specified:
at the plot level, in the extensionPoints property, without need to prefix the extension point with the plot id or name.
at the plot options level, directly, without need to prefix the extension point with the plot id or name.
if it is an internal plot (main, plot2 or trend), at the chart options level, directly.
This bullet chart type was only partially updated, to support some of the new CCC v.2 features.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: bullet)
extension property (ex: panel)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: bulletPanel_strokeStyle (see ).

c:property.name: bulletsPanel
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the bullets panel mark, must be used without the bullet prefix.
One instance of this panel is generated per datum.

c:property.name: panel
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet panel mark.

c:property.name: range
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet ranges bar mark.

c:property.name: measure
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet measures bar mark.

c:property.name: marker
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet markers dot mark.

c:property.name: rule
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet axis ticks rule mark.

c:property.name: ruleLabel
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet axis ticks label mark.

c:property.name: title
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet title label mark.

c:property.name: subtitle
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet sub-title label mark.

c:complexType.name: BulletPlotVisualRoles
c:complexType.c:documentation: The visual roles options class of the bullet plot type.

c:property.name: title
c:property.c:documentation:
The title visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents the title of each bullet.
The title visual role automatically binds to all dimensions whose name has the title prefix.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: subTitle
c:property.c:documentation:
The subTitle visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents the sub-title of each bullet.
The subTitle visual role automatically binds to all dimensions whose name has the subTitle prefix.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: value
c:property.c:documentation:
The value visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents the main measure under analysis, for a given title and sub-title categories, and is visually encoded by the length of a bar visual element.
The values, one for each dimension bound to the value role, are represented by overlapping bars, each painted with a successively brighter blue color. The length of each bar is proportional to the corresponding value. Negative values are considered 0.
The value visual role automatically binds to all numeric dimensions whose name has the value prefix.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: marker
c:property.c:documentation:
The marker visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents a set of reference or target values for a given title and sub-title categories, and is visually encoded by the positions of markers/dots along the bullet's axis.
Negative values are considered 0.
Each dimension that is bound to the marker role is represented by a different marker.
The marker visual role automatically binds to all numeric dimensions whose name has the marker prefix.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: range
c:property.c:documentation:
The range visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents classification threshold values of the value visual role.
The value domain is split into several parts (or classes) at the given points.
Each dimension that is bound to the range role splits the value domain at a certain point.
By default, each part is painted with a successively brighter gray color.
The range visual role automatically binds to all numeric dimensions whose name has the range prefix.
See for more information on supported data types.
